text:
Today, I am gonna introduce you how did Alex Dupont, a french sociologist, introduced dreams in the sociological sciences.
First of all, sociology is a quite recent science. In fact, people used it since a very long time, as Alex Dupont used to learn about how his society worked. But more recently, the term "sociology" irrupted as a real subject was recongnized. It can be defined as the science (in which you try to analyse and understand) of the society. Consequently, it is about to understand social phenomena.
Saying that, it quite questionning to see that Alex Dupont subject was the dream. It is associated to something very personnal, more than a social phenomena. Here was his challenge. Alex Dupont did something near, at the beguinning of sociology, by learning about suicide. Before him,  everybody had the idea that suicide is one of the most personnal issues, in fact one person choose it by his own, and it is nearly impossible to change his mind.
Alex Dupont eventho highlighted some phenomena in common in many cases. As an exemple, there are less suicides during war time. Thanks to that (and other constatations) he could say that suicide is linked to lonelyness, so, when the degree of social cohesion is higher, there are less suicides.
Alex Dupont wanted in first position, to insist on the methodology. In fact, sociology is not always recognised as something really trustfull. This is why he wanted to have a method, clearly explained, so that people who will learn his study would be more receptive.
In a seceond time, he applied his method. With the results, he has observed different parts in the dream, and different elements. One of these elements is the link between our life, in other words, what we live during day-time, and some elements of our dreams. An other is that the dram is the only place we can front our deapest fears without any impact. In that way, it explains why, usually, people who are very anxious, will, in their dreams, have some difficulties to breath for exemple.
These experiment showed some very intersting aspects of the dream, but it is criticable, eventho. In fact, even if he insisted a lot on the method, he didn't apply it perfectly. He based his study on some older researches. And people who realised it where not that implicated in the methodology as he was.
Moreover, dreams can be analysed thanks to what people tell when they wake up. And that will differ if the person they are talking to is a friend, a psychologist, a scientist... And it is impossible to have influence in that. Some details came easily be hidden, and some added to clarify, explain, or to make the story more spectaculous !
Despite that, Alex Dupont study was a step in sociology, as I explained it befire, such as Alex Dupont study about suicide was in the beguinnings of sociology as a science by itself.
